title: Mrs Hinch fan shares miracle washing machine cleaning trick and it's so simple
text:

Dirty washing can feel like an endless cycle.

As soon as you've washed, dried and ironed one load, the basket is already overflowing with grubby clothes just waiting for you to start the process all over again.

After all that we've never stopped to give thought to cleaning the washing machine itself (because that's its job) but people are going mad for one Mrs Hinch fan's £4 hack to making it a very easy task, as reported by Birmingham Live .

Mrs Hinch became a famed Essex cleaning guru after sharing her cleaning tips and envy-inducing pictures of her immaculate home on social media, gaining almost three million followers on Instagram .

(Image: KentLive/ WS)

Her loyal legion of fans now have their own ' Mrs Hinch Made Me Do It ' Facebook group where they share their own tricks of the trade and ask other members for advice.

When one member moved into a new flat, she posted a photo of her filthy washing machine drawer and asked for help to restore it to its former glory.

Taking advice, she rinsed the drawer with Fairy Platinum washing up liquid and then used an old toothbrush to finely clean it.

(Image: KentLive/ WS)

She revealed 'I used bicarbonate of soda and white vinegar to remove all odours and smells' and finished the transformation by using 75p Astonish Mould and Mildew spray.

Posting an after photo of the sparkling cleaning job, she advised others to soak the drawer in hot water before turning on the washing machine to remove any lasting mould.

The post proved a hit with other Hinchers, who were impressed with the transformation.

One said "Wow, great job! Mine looks like your before photo. On my list to do this week."

Another wrote: "I want to also do this, I was thinking toothbrush too!"

Until they make a washing machine for our washing machines, it looks like we'll be doing this.
description: A member of a Mrs Hinch Facebook group posted incredible before and after pictures of the cleaning job
